prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: what is the best treatment for psoriasis

PATIENT: hello doctor I am suffering with psoriasis please suggest treatment

DOCTOR: hello I saw your photograph you are having psoriasis and I would like to tell you about your disease psoriasis is a relapsing condition and usually exacerbates in winters it will not spread to other people by touching it will not affect your internal organs it is treatable but not curable it will get cleared but can reappear nothing to worry about it as it is in limited area only application of topical steroids will suffice but if there is more body involvement then we will start oral medicines presently I am prescribing your treatment and you can review in 20 days papulosquamous inflammatory disorder liver function test and complete blood count chronic plaque psoriasis topical clobetasol propionate ointment for local application in evening tablet levocetirizine my evening conut oil for local application in evening and morning use oil or moisturizer keep skin supple review after 20 days

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I have a cyst and suffer irregular period can I take I pill

PATIENT: hi doctor I had unprotected sex with my girlfriend but I have not ejaculated in her is there any chance for pregnancy some yellow substance was there on the tip of my penis what is that

DOCTOR: hi the process you have adopted while performing sex is termed as withdrawal method though this is a commonly practiced method there exists reason for failure the cause is some of your sperms could be present in your precum that is some amount of clear secretion from penis before the ejaculation it could cause a pregnancy contrary to your belief no sperm will be present in the yellow deposit termed smegma finally you have to consider in which day of her period you had sex if she is in between day to day 17 of her cycle chances are high otherwise there is no such apparent risk for further doubts consult an obstetrician and gynaecologist online

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: what shall I do for spider veins and swollen legs

PATIENT: hi doctor I am 60 years old I am in excellent health I just had medical checkup and everything fine except cholesterol reading of 320 despite a healthy diet and exercise my problem is peripheral edema spider veins and swollen legs which is often very painful after standing for a long time in the past has spent a long time standing at work I have good shoes and surgical stockings for help I am not on any medication for this I have this problem for over five years now please help

DOCTOR: hello I had gone through all the data posted revert back with the report details to an internal medicine physician online

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: what causes persistent dizziness when standing up

PATIENT: hello doctor I am 35 years old female experiencing dizziness every time I stand up quickly from sitting or lying position this has been happening for about 3 months sometimes I feel like I might faint and my vision gets blurry for few seconds I have normal blood pressure readings when checked at clinic no history of diabetes or heart problems I drink plenty of water and eat regular meals

DOCTOR: hello what you are describing sounds like orthostatic hypotension which means your blood pressure drops when you change positions this is common and usually not serious but should be evaluated first ensure you are drinking enough fluids about 2-3 liters daily and add some salt to your diet unless you have hypertension when standing up do it slowly first sit at edge of bed for minute then stand try compression stockings if symptoms persist need to check complete blood count thyroid function tests and echocardiogram to rule out underlying conditions review after 2 weeks with these test results

STATUS: medium severity
